raw_comment:
1) I notice that the young women in the study are more likely to contact their parents than the young men. Both men and women tend to choose online communication rather than in-person. The most popular way of communication seems to be through sending texts.
2) Why are women more likely to contact their parents than men are? Does gender play a role? Societal standards? 
3) This relates to me and my community because as everyone leaves for college, staying in contact with parents becomes a question.
4) How Often Are You Contacting Your Parents?
ace_sentences: Young women in the study are more likely to contact their parents than young men in the study.
Young men tend to choose online communication rather than in-person communication.
Young women tend to choose online communication rather than in-person communication.
Sending texts is the most popular way of communication.
Women are more likely to contact their parents than men.
I ask why women are more likely to contact their parents than men.
I ask whether gender plays a role.
I ask whether societal standards play a role.
Everyone in my community leaves for college.
Staying in contact with parents becomes a question.
The headline is: How often are you contacting your parents?
